comments.raw_text:
Per current HTML5 draft, firing the load event on a window should post an async task to fire a load event on the iframe element containing that window.  See http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-web-perf/2011Oct/0083.html 

Do we want to do that?  Note that we'd have to be careful to not fire the iframe element onload before the parent window onload.....

Alternately, does the spec need changes of some sort here?

comments.text:
In this kinds of cases the spec often just defines some behavior without any rationale - 
that is at least my experience.  So, need to test it.

In many ways, I do prefer our behavior. It should be less fragile to use it than async load 
event.

(In reply to Boris Zbarsky (:bz) from comment #0) 
> Note that we'd have to be careful to not fire the
> iframe element onload before the parent window onload.....
Do you mean the 'after', not 'before'?
